triples.o: average value over a short interval
triples.evidence: This concept of 'average value over a short interval' will help us understand how the delta function works when it comes to sampling a continuous function.

Somewhere between a and b, there’s at least one point, which we’ll call c, where the height of the function at that point - f of c - multiplied by the width of the interval, gives you the same area as the one under the curve.
